job_purpose: Drive advanced data science initiatives focused on biosensor current analysis and modeling for cutting-edge fetal lactate monitoring technology.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Design and implement advanced algorithms for analyzing biosensor current signals, FHR, and ECG
Develop predictive models for current-lactate algorithm
Design and develop algorithms for signal feature detection and calculation of key clinical metrics
Create sophisticated feature extraction techniques specific to biosensor outputs
Design filters and noise reduction algorithms
Implement real-time signal processing solutions for continuous lactate monitoring
Perform rigorous testing and validation of models
Develop APIs and integration layers for biosensor data consumption by clinical systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define model requirements
Translate business needs into technical solutions
Ensure modeling and analytical approaches meet medical device regulatory standards
Support regulatory submissions with technical analyses and validation reports
Generate clinical evidence packages demonstrating model/algorithm validity and safety
Support team and company objectives beyond direct expertise
required_qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or related field
5+ years of experience in a similar data science role
Expert-level proficiency in Python with emphasis on signal processing libraries
Solid background in signal processing and time series analysis
Hands-on experience with KNIME, MATLAB, or similar platforms
Expertise in SQL and experience with Snowflake
Superior proficiency in machine learning principles and techniques
Strong understanding of data science methodologies
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
preferred_qualifications: Advanced coursework or certification in data science, machine learning, or biomedical signal processing
Experience in clinical, healthcare, or medical device setting
company_details: VitalTrace Pty Ltd is a multi-award-winning, VC-funded Australian-based Med-tech start-up company aiming to improve outcomes for mothers and children during the childbirth process. The company develops novel cutting-edge biosensor technologies for fetal monitoring during childbirth, with a focus on accuracy and timely decision-making in clinical settings. The team consists of clinicians, researchers, engineers, chemists, software developers, and data scientists working collaboratively towards enhancing maternal and child healthcare.
